## Abstract

###### Loading the required libraries

```{r, warning = FALSE, message = FALSE}
#Installing libraries
if(!require('pacman'))
  installed.packages('pacman')

#Loading the packages
pacman::p_load(
  ggplot,
  readr,
  tidyr,
  dplyr,
  RColorBrewer,
  gganimate,
  plotly
)

```

###### Setting up the theme

```{r}
#Setting the theme 
ggplot2::theme_set(ggplot2::theme_minimal(base_size = 11))

# Figure resolution
knitr::opts_chunk$set(
  fig.retina = 3, 
  dpi = 300, 
  fig.width = 6, 
  fig.asp = 0.618 
  )

```

###### Loading the data set

```{r, warning = FALSE, message = FALSE}
usa_county_wise <- read_csv('https://raw.githubusercontent.com/INFO-526-S24/project-final-GraphGeeks/main/data/usa_county_wise.csv')

```

## Bubble Maps

```{r, warning = FALSE, message = FALSE}
usa <- usa_county_wise

usa <- na.omit(usa)

usa <- usa |> filter(Confirmed > 10000 & Long_ != 0)
  
usa <- usa |> rename(long = Long_)

head(usa)

library(sf)
library(maps)

# Get map data
us_map <- map_data("state")

# Filter map data to New York
ny_map <- subset(us_map, region == "usa")

# Plot the map
p <- ggplot(usa, aes(x = long, y = Lat)) +
  geom_polygon(data = us_map, aes(x = long, y = lat, group = group), color = "black", fill = "#ebf5ee")+
  geom_point(aes(color = Confirmed, size = usa$Confirmed)) +
  scale_color_gradient(low = "#7bbd8c", high = "#021c09", name = "Confirmed Cases")+
  labs(x = "Longitude", y = "Latitude", title = "Lat/Long Coordinates")



# Add the US map as a background layer
p 
  

```
